newsitem.title: CHINA: China futures exchange expels members in crackdown.
newsitem.headline: China futures exchange expels members in crackdown.

text.p: The Beijing Commodity Exchange has expelled four members and warned another 27 as part of a crackdown on futures trading irregularities, the Financial News said on Wednesday.
it said the four firms barred by the exchange included a local electronics firm, Beijing Zhongliying Electronic Publishing Development Co, and a Tibet-based property developer.
The newspaper said the four were linked to serious criminal cases that were under investigation. It did not give details.
It did not give the total number of exchange members. The exchange reorganised itself, setting up a member system this year.
The exchange warned 23 member firms for ignoring an exchange order and another four firms for poor management of customer trading, it said.
Market regulators have been aiming to curb what they see as excessive speculation in futures trading, and they have been pressing domestic exchanges to enforce regulations.
